tds

Class TaskTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • tds.TaskTree

  • public class TaskTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for storing and manipulating Task via TreeSet.
    Author:
    amoshydra
    See Also:
    Task, Attributes

      • init

        public static void init(java.util.Collection<Task> collection)
        Initialize new tree sets containing the Task objects in the specified TaskTree, sorted according according to the ordering of each attributes in the task.
        Parameters:
        collection - whose Task objects will comprise the new set

        public static boolean add(Task task)
        Adds the specified Task object to this TaskTree
        Parameters:
        task - to be added to this TaskTree
        Returns:
        true if this TaskTree did not already contain the specified Task object

        Parameters:

      • searchName

        public static java.util.List<Task> searchName(java.lang.String searchTerm)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects contain the searchTerm. The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        searchTerm - the sequence to search for
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task object contain the searchTerm

      • queryStartTime

        public static java.util.List<Task> queryStartTime(long fromStartTime,
                                                  long toStartTime)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromStartTime, inclusive, to toStartTime, inclusive. (If fromStartTime and toStartTime are equal, the returned List contains Task object that matches fromEndTime.) The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        fromStartTime - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        toStartTime - high endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromStartTime, inclusive, to toStartTime, inclusive

      • queryEndTime

        public static java.util.List<Task> queryEndTime(long fromEndTime,
                                                long toEndTime)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromEndTime, inclusive, to toEndTime, inclusive. (If fromEndTime and toEndTime are equal, the returned List contains Task object that matches fromEndTime only.) The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        fromEndTime - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        toEndTime - high endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromEndTime, inclusive, to toEndTime, inclusive

      • queryFlag

        public static java.util.List<Task> queryFlag(Task.FLAG_TYPE fromFlag,
                                             Task.FLAG_TYPE toFlag)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromFlag, inclusive, to toFlag, inclusive. (If fromFlag and toFlag are equal, the returned List contains Task object that matches fromFlag only.) The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        fromFlag - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        toFlag - high endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromFlag, inclusive, to toFlag , inclusive

      • queryPriority

        public static java.util.List<Task> queryPriority(Task.PRIORITY_TYPE fromPriority,
                                                 Task.PRIORITY_TYPE toPriority)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromPriority, inclusive, to toPriority , inclusive. (If fromPriority and toPriority are equal, the returned List contains Task object that matches fromPriority only.) The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        fromPriority - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        toPriority - high endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromPriority, inclusive, to toPriority, inclusive

      • query

        public static java.util.List<Task> query(Attributes.TYPE taskAttributeType,
                                         long fromValueL,
                                         long toValueL)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromValueL, inclusive, to toValueL, inclusive given the specified taskAttributeType. (If fromValueL and toValueL are equal, the returned List contains Task object that matches fromValueL only.) The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa. To query flag and priority, please use its respective query method.
        Parameters:
        taskAttributeType - the attribute type to be query with.
        fromValueL - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        toValueL - high endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects range from fromValueL, inclusive, to toValueL, inclusive

      • searchFlag

        public static java.util.List<Task> searchFlag(Task.FLAG_TYPE type)
        Returns a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects matches the flagSearch. The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        type - to search for
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects match the flagSearch
        See Also:
        Task

      • searchPriority

        public static java.util.List<Task> searchPriority(Task.PRIORITY_TYPE type)

        Parameters:
        type - to search for
        Returns:
        a view of the portion of this TaskTree whose Task objects match the prioritySearch
        See Also:

      • getList

        public static java.util.List<Task> getList()
        Returns a view of this TaskTree whose Task objects are sorted according to order it is created. The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Returns:
        a view of this TaskTree.

      • getSortedList

        public static java.util.List<Task> getSortedList(Attributes.TYPE taskAttributeType)
        Returns a view of this TaskTree whose Task objects are sorted according to its specified attribute type. The returned List is backed by this TaskTree, so changes in the returned List are reflected in this TaskTree, and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        taskAttributeType - the attribute type to be sorted with.
        Returns:
        a view of this TaskTree whose Task objects are sorted according to its specified attribute type.
        See Also:
        Attributes

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString()
        Returns a string representation of this TaskTree. The string representation consists of a list of the TaskTree's Task objects in the order they are returned by its iterator, enclosed in square brackets ("[]"). Adjacent Task objects are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). Task objects are converted to strings as by String.toString(Object).
        Returns:
        a string representation of this task tree in a list.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(Attributes.TYPE taskAttributeType)
        Return a string representation of this TaskTree sorted in order of the specified taskAttributeType. The string representation consists of a list of the TaskTree's Task objects in the order they are returned by its iterator, enclosed in square brackets ("[]"). Adjacent Task objects are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). Task objects are converted to strings as by String.toString(Object).
        Parameters:
        taskAttributeType - the attribute type to be printed.
        Returns:
        a string representation of this task tree in a list.

      • size

        public static int size()
        Return total number of task in this tree
        Returns:
        number of task in this tree
